channel.title: 317 Server Protocol - Format/Layout - Python
channel.description:
Trying to wrap my head around the format of the messages a server sends when logging in a user.
Some points to help clarify my situation:
[ul][li]I'm referencing this document for the requests and responses: https://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/317-Protocol[/li] [li]I'm working in Python[/li] [li]I've also got a working socket server listening on the standard port. With this I am able to receive messages from the client and send messages back.[/li] [li]I also have a standard 317 client I am pointing at said socket server.[/li][/ul]
Anyone have any good examples of the login process in action? Or even an example of how a single message should be formatted?

item.title: 317 Server Protocol - Format/Layout - Python
item.dc:creator: @rwphone1996 rwphone1996
item.description:
@rwphone1996 wrote:

Trying to wrap my head around the format of the messages a server sends when logging in a user.

Some points to help clarify my situation:

[ul][li]I’m referencing this document for the requests and responses: https://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/317-Protocol[/li]
[li]I’m working in Python[/li]
[li]I’ve also got a working socket server listening on the standard port. With this I am able to receive messages from the client and send messages back.[/li]
[li]I also have a standard 317 client I am pointing at said socket server.[/li][/ul]

Anyone have any good examples of the login process in action? Or even an example of how a single message should be formatted?
